intro: Vandenboschia subclathrata, commonly known as the Cape sugarbush, is a South African shrub belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, thorny foliage and small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates. Vandenboschia subclathrata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
